title: Easy Hibiscus Tea: Best Nigerian Sobo Drink: Perfect Sorrel Juice Recipe
p1: In the Caribbean sorrel plants flower around Christmas. This made sorrel drink a Christmas treat. That's how I thought of it until I realized that we brought this drink from West Africa. The drink then took on a new meaning: the preservation of culture in a foreign land. Sorrel drink, also known as Zobo drink or Sobolo, is a tangy, refreshing, and satisfying drink that tastes amazing and is highly nutritious.
p2: Enjoy on a hot summer day or as a relaxing evening drink!

content.h2: What are the benefits of drinking Sobo Drink?

paragraphs.p: Frankly, I strongly believe that the African 9 strands of DNA (as oppose to everyone else's 6 strands) reguire the ancestral foods that made our people the strongest human specimen. When we deviate from what we've eaten since the start of time, we make ourselves and future generations weaker.
paragraphs.p1: Sorrel petals are high in antioxidants, specifically high in flavinoids that are powerful antioxidants, vitamin C and iron.
paragraphs.p2: Ginger is anti-inflammatory and aid in digestion.
paragraphs.p3: The spices in sobo drink are also medicinal: cloves have been touted to support liver health.

li2.h2: Can pregnant women eat Sobo Drink?

paragraphs.p: Absolutely! Babies would be delighted by the plethora of nutrients that this African superfood delivers. Be sure to consume it in moderation, however. Please consult your physician if you have any concerns.

li4.h2: How to make Nigerian Sobo Drink?

instructions.li1: Soak your beans in a covered container or pot of water for 8 hours
instructions.li3: Cook beans until its just starting to become tender
instructions.li4: Heat up a pot with Palm Oil
instructions.li5: Place your onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and parprika into the oil
instructions.li6: Once the above ingredients begin to give off their aromas, put in the chicken, maggi cubes, smoked shrimp, stock water, chicken, and Afican Black Beans into the pot
instructions.li7: Throw in a whole scotch bonnet pepper and salt to taste

paragraphs.p: One of my favorite recipe variations is to blend pineapple, ginger and dates till smooth and at the blend to the drink.
